intro: Ferulago abbreviata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferulago, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are narrow and deeply lobed, while its flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Ferulago abbreviata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
